newsitem.title: CHINA: EU's Brittan says may champion China WTO bid to US.
newsitem.headline: EU's Brittan says may champion China WTO bid to US.

text.p: European Commission Vice-President Sir Leon Brittan said on Thursday he might soon urge the United States to move quickly on China's long-stalled plan to join the World Trade Organisation (WTO).

Brittan told a business conference in Beijing that if he got reaffirmation from the Chinese side, "I will certainly take up the matter with the Americans with extreme urgency ... urging them that the time has come" for movement.

Brittan said he would meet senior Chinese officials during his stay and seek a reaffirmation of China's willingness to accept Europe's position and then might make the call for quick action on the part of the United States.

Europe has said it was willing to be flexible on a timetable for China's full implementation of WTO rules but has added that Beijing must make clear its commitment to full compliance and give a substantial, initial movement on market access.
On Wednesday, Chinese leaders denounced Beijing's exclusion from the WTO as unjust, saying the world's largest developing nation had made great strides in opening its markets to trade and investment.
